other_tests.findings: Elevated levels of catecholamines and total metanephrines.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Failed to normalize postoperatively and remained elevated and stable over time.

other_tests.findings: Increased uptake in the proximal left femur, consistent with a well-defined lytic lesion.
other_tests.changes_over_time: The metastatic lesion in the femur remained unchanged.

other_tests.findings: Uptake in the liver, left femur, and posterior mediastinum near the aortic arch.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Findings were unchanged in subsequent imaging in October 2001.

other_tests.findings: A large hypervascular lobulated mass in the caudate and right lobes of the liver causing complete occlusion of the vena cava.
other_tests.changes_over_time: No pronounced change in size compared with previous images obtained over 22 years.

other_tests.findings: A missense point mutation (c.725G3A) was detected, altering R242 to H242.
Elevated total metanephrines and catecholamine levels: total metanephrines 9.1 Î¼mol, norepinephrine 4622 nmol, epinephrine 24 nmol, dopamine 2808 nmol.
No evidence of recurrent or metastatic disease.
other_tests.changes_over_time: 24-h urinary excretion of catecholamines and total metanephrines remained normal through April 2002.
